page.title: 23Kemsing School Centenary
page.content:
Kemsing School is situated in the centre of the village. In 1985 it has celebrated its centenary.

It opened in 1885 with a roll of 75. Attendance in those early days fluctuated greatly with the harvesting and hopping season.

Fenella, a pupil at the school now, tells us about a typical day in 1985:

School begins with registration and assembly at 9am. Until playtime at 10.30 they work at mathematics. After a short break is English, a story to write, poetry, grammar work or reading. Dinner is at 12 until 1.10pm. The afternoon work is art/craft, projects and sport. School finishes at 3.15pm. School clubs include Netball, Football, Swingball, Tennis, Cricket, Rounders and Swimming.

Whereas the number of students had been falling, the school is now over-subscribed and a new Head Teahcer was appointed in 2003.

Many families have moved away from Kemsing to find jobs and cheaper homes.

Contribution by: Kemsing Heritage Centre Association
